title: "Malzahar is a tryhard champ that people only pick when they want to win"
body:
Said by the Zed player, who tried harder than anyone I've ever seen in a norm who also does "/all ?" every single time _he_ goes in on anyone and kills them.

When did Malzahar become a champ that people only pick when they want to win?  And why isn't everyone picking him in ranked right now getting to master tier?  And since when was this any more than a Zed main picking Zed in non-ranked to win lane/game? lol

I can understand people being somewhat irritated by Malz's kit and his R, but I'm quite certain about 95% of the community (at least in this elo) are more irritated by Zeds kit and his R, and how tryhard Zed mains usually are.

-Signed, not a Malzahar main (but playing him for fun).

replies.body:
You have to think of it from the Zed's point of view.

Since he is a zed player, he most likely only plays champs who could be an anime protagonist / antagonist. While malzahar is cool and all, I just couldn't see him in an anime. If he couldn't be in an anime, that means they are a tryhards champ. 

At least that's how a zed explained something similar to me.

Oh man I never thought of it that way.  Now I understand all the underlying frustration I picked up from him... like he was on some great big ninja quest and suddenly this unusual character appears from a Void that makes no sense to him and his world...
Something something shinigami.
SENBONZAKURAAAAAAAAA!!!!

Totally true, as a Zed main I also enjoy a lot of hentais, especially with ninjas involved.
xD

Isn't malzahar like some evil pokemon villain?
{{champion:103}} definitely anime
{{champion:141}} {{champion:157}} everyone's FAVORITE anime
... can you find the rest?
Lol go look at old Malz some time.  Dude was bishonen af.
malz and beautiful? lolz ^^
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/l_GaYUhSwDc/hqdefault.jpg

Malz has two dump spells who doesn't need skill at all:
His point and click ult - which is easy countered like zed ult but you need an unnecessary item for it which delays your power spike unlike hourglass.
And his ... W? which is also point and click and hits cruse the enemy with an isane amount of sustain dmg - nearly as toxic as Mordes overbuffed ultimate.

Ofc a Zedplayer is salty, cause Zed player who are good and tryhard need actual skill - unlike Morde, Malz and Veigars.

So by this logic we should all play only champs that have 4 skillshots and then bitch and cry about any champs at all that don't?

And we should all get to diamond or higher when we play champs that don't, cus they're the "tryhard" champs that are meant only to win?  As opposed to Zed mains _playing their main, in a norm_ which is only there to have fun and not, insult people like a bad troll and "/all ?" spam?

lol

Skillshots definitely equate to skill. That's why Lux is super hardcore korean challenger Faker level. Only the top players can use her effectively barely scraping a 50% win rate, and it only goes down with rank.

Ryze on the other hand, super easy. It's a known fact that he completely pubstomps in low elos, but is never played by Diamond+, much less in the pro scene. That's why he's getting more nerfs and Lux was getting more buffs on PBE.

> Skillshots definitely equate to skill.

Not always. Skillshots by nature are something that once you fire them, you cant adjust them.  Your opponent has time to react (or rather can depending on reflexes) to the course of a skillshot. The caster of the skillshot can aim in 2 locations. 1 the target's current location, and 2 a probable location.  But unless your skillshot is a laser ( meaning this applies to lux and xerath only if i recall correctly, tho despite being lasers they have delays so their opponents can evade them if they want ) your opponent can adjust his position according to your skillshot.

> [{quoted}](name=VanaQuish,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EUWBviWs,comment-id=0002000100000000,timestamp=2018-04-14T20:10:37.734+0000)
>
> Not always. Skillshots by nature are something that once you fire them, you cant adjust them. 

Someone has been playing Zoe.

I don't get this reply.

If he'd been playing Zoe he'd know that Skillshots are adjustable. 

Hell Even Lux's is. You can choose when to pop her E after firing it.

> [{quoted}](name=Sexy Jack Rabbit,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EUWBviWs,comment-id=000200010000000000000001,timestamp=2018-04-15T02:51:43.255+0000)

Zoe's q is the only one I can think of that lets you redirect it after you cast it. I'd say calling them adjustable is a poor taste of words. at least for my understanding.

i didnt say to insult ppl who play champs without skillshots, but they are much harder and yes, it's easier to climb by playing just outdated point-and-click champs. 

think about it: a 1v1, one plays a point and click champ the other one a champ with nearly just skillshots. the guy who plays the skillshot champ needs to play far more better and when he wins he deserves to spam his mastery more, than the other one - except yasuos ofc. lul

Malzahar's W is what summons the voidlings. Do you mean his E (Malefic Visions) which is the DoT ability?

I will admit, he does take little to no skill, but people can still manage to do bad on him. Zed's also fairly easy to play. Just hard to master. The game is not instantly lost if a Malzahar is on the enemy team, as with all champions.

ment his E, thank you. ofc! you can play bad with every champ even with easy ones. look me play garen or vlad. i hate it. xD 

>> The game is not instantly lost if a Malzahar is on the enemy team, as with all champions.<< thats your opinion and i am fine with it cause i didnt mention anything like that.

> I will admit, he does take little to no skill, **but people can still manage to do bad on him.**

I mean, I lost really hard to a Yasuo once as Malz, so yeah. I felt ashamed at myself for screwing up so hard on a very simple champion.

This comes from a former Malz main btw.
Yeah. When I mess up a lot on my (current) mains, Talon and Malz I get a little pissed off since they are considered "easy" champions.

There's no such thing as tryhard in League, like who tf doesn't play to win? LOL

If you're tryna have fun try AI Beginners

There _are_ some times where I do fuck around and just want to play with my friends, and we don't take matches as seriously as usual. But we do indeed try to win.  We still want to win, maybe less than usual, but it's always there.

And that Zed most definitely wanted to win more than the other 9 players in the match.

uhhhh what? can't tell if sarcastic or actually that stupid...

Malzahar literally doesn't exist in high elo.  You don't pick Malz because you want to win.  You pick Malz because you're auto fill and don't have a champion to play.  Malzahar is so weak right now he doesn't even beat assassins in lane, he literally doesn't have the damage to pressure a kill on a misplay, he only exists to press R on someone so your winning jungle can win harder, if he's losing you might as well just int yourself.

Course assassin players are entitled bums so obviously they should be able to play league of legends on you and you should just get to watch.

Anti-Assassin champions don't really exist anymore tbh. 

{{champion:1}} {{champion:127}} {{champion:90}} all suck nowaday.
They all possessed a niche that was "Anti-Assassin-Anti-Mobility" 

Malzhar and Lissandra were born into, whereas Annie was reworked into.

But nowaday they're all so inviable Assassins shit all over them.
“You are a tryhard until I buy QSS and shut down your entire point of picking Malzahar”

"But QSS delays my damage spike, so I'll be behind if I build it!" -Zed players
"Zed is totally fine, just rush the cost-ineffective Hourglass which provides no mana or mana sustain to have a chance to survive." -also Zed players
i for one agree.  a true league player only plays champions with the intent to lose.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Reminder all the headache with malz started because he commited the crime of being a good matchup vs zed back during the zed meta, and he really should just be reverted to pre-rework.

I reserve the /all ? For when I get tower dive at 5% hp and walk away with a double.
the "?" is normal for a zed player to drop. i would ask him if he is ok if he wasnt doing that.
Not defending the zed here or anything, he was just being an idiot, but I see people saying that playing your main in normals is tryhard. Maybe you main a champ because you have fun playing it?

Got a feeling you got downvoted purely based on your name here. I'm primarily a normal player. So what should I do since I don't play ranked? Get a champion to mastery 7 and then never touch them again because it would be "tryhard"? People like Zed in the OP are just asses tho, but there will always be some like that - not everyone is a douchey tryhard because they play a champion they are good at in normals.
I play my main on normals cause she is one of the three champions left that I can spam multiple games on and not get bored. Oh. And I don't play ranked.
Idk who said that but the fact they don't know you can get out of it through items is kinda disturbing.
lmfao said by the zed who tried harder than anybody
Malzahar is literally a cancer champion, who the fuck would rather play an auto q w r bot than a champion that actually has to hit skillshots?
LMAO try wukong, he is literally an EQR bot, and if the R doesn't kill you then the EQ spam will

Except Zed's skillshots are completely made irrelevant once he has R.

It's not a skillshot at point-blank range. You're just incompetent if you miss it. It's instant-cast, and at point blank.

Now, sure, Zed has skill expression *before* he ults. And if he wants to maximize damage, he has to aim something. But he doesn't need to hit QE from both ghosts right now, he has enough damage to kill someone without doing more than landing *maybe* a second Q from him.

I mean, post-6, Malzahar still has to aim his Q. Even after he ults, because his Q still has the same delay on it. Zed...Still has no delay on it.

Sorry, I mixed up his skills. I meant in regard to him w e w e w e w e w e w e w e the wave infinitely, not interacting with a laner, having a passive shield for no damn reason, and being a free kill for a jungler.

A good Malz makes your champion i r r e l e v a n t

so is that the reason why every malzahar main is instantly master/challenger level? everyone keeps telling me he wins stupid hard and takes no skill whatsoever... guess im gonna have to start playing him more and maining him myself then.
As a {{champion:240}} main I have no idea how good malz is supposed to be, my Q turns his passive off, my Ult and passive turn his ult of and he cant run... sooo... hes not THAT strong right?
